overview:
Serving as an online and interactive building community, Shortpath’s facility management system offers a suite of patented web-based and mobile applications and tools designed to empower professionals, connect people, and build relationships.

Applications such as the Work Order System, Delivery Scheduling, Preventative Maintenance, Electronic Logbook, and Visitor Management all help simplify the exchange of products, services, and information among building owners, office managers, tenants and vendors, while applications such as Concierge and Marketplace help connect people at work with the goods and services they need everyday, all from one centralized portal.

In 2011, Shortpath launched its Event Scheduling & Conference Room Booking tools which could be utilized in two ways: building-wide or office exclusive. The Event Scheduling & Conference Room booking apps help users manage shared spaces and view a shared calendar of room reservations.

For facility managers, in addition to reducing the operational costs and increasing profitability in their building, Shortpath provides tenants and vendors with an engaging portal that includes specific building information, an interactive building-wide message board, and the opportunity to network with in-building tenants.

Their award winning software and used in some of most influential buildings in the World such as the MTA Headquarters and The Time Warner Center in New York City. Operating in over 20 million sq. ft. and scalable to any size facility including hospitals, hotels, restaurants, offices, condominiums and schools,

Shortpath’s client list includes CUNY, Mandarin Oriental Hotel, Whole Foods, Barclays Capital, and Skidmore Owings & Merrill.
